items.title: OpenAI made a TikTok for deepfakes, and it’s getting hard to tell what’s real
items.summary: On Monday, I watched OpenAI CEO Sam Altman drink from a gigantic mango-flavored juice box and remark aloud about how the box was half his size. The catch: It wasn't really Altman. The juice box wasn't real. He wasn't really talking. It was a deepfake generated by AI. The most concerning part: I couldn't tell […]

Today’s 41% discount marks the lowest price we have tracked for this SSD in 2025, and it’s also the lowest price we’ve tracked for it in over a year. items.title: LEGO’s massive Star Wars UCS Death Star is officially open for purchase with a GWP set at $1,000
items.summary:
With the clock having officially ticked us over into October, LEGO is releasing its next wave of new building sets, including the much-buzzed-about Star Wars 75419 UCS Death Star set that is definitely taking center stage for folks able to shell out the hefty $999.99 price tag. This new set has been carrying three titles since it was revealed at the top of September: LEGO’s largest build to date, as well as the most expensive build, and the most accompanying minifigure collection. What’s more, picking this set up in the first week of its release will also net you an exclusive GWP (more on that below the fold).

items.title: Don’t miss Samsung’s 2025 27- and 32-inch Odyssey OLED G8 4K 240Hz gaming monitors while they’re up to $470 off
items.summary:
Over at Samsung, you’ll find the brand’s latest Odyssey G8 (G81SF) QD-OLED 27-inch gaming monitor down at $829.99 shipped with a $50 upgrade bonus credit that auto-applies during checkout for instant redemption. Similarly, the 32-inch model is available for $949.99 shipped at the moment. These typically go for $1,300, so you’re looking at up to $470 in savings right now. These are the lowest prices we have tracked for these models to date, so be sure to jump in if you were eyeing these and were waiting for a discount. Amazon is matching the base discounted prices at $879.99 and $999.99 shipped for the 27-inch and 32-inch models, respectively, but you’ll miss out on the upgrade bonus. Head below for more details.

Outside of discounts, you’d be shelling out $170 for this model at full price, which we’ve seen dropping to $128 twice before in 2025 and a fall lower to $120 that occurred during July’s Prime Day event. You can pick your own up today with $42 slashed from the tag, giving you the second-best price of the year that only sits $8 above July’s annual low.

The smallest of these here would normally run you $190 at full price, which we’ve mostly seen drop between $170 and $160 over the year, with some select falls lower to $157 last seen in August. Today’s deal gives you a solid $30 markdown off the going rate for the second-best price of the year and the fourth-lowest overall – just $8 above the all-time low.
